event.summary: 07/14/1993: A man was arrested at a north London bus stop carrying a large Semtex bomb in a shoulder bag. The perpetrator is believed to be a key figure in the Irish Republican Army's (IRA) mainland bombing campaign. Police believe he intended to take the 8 lb bomb into the City of London by public transport. The motive for the attack was cited as the IRA's response to new traffic restrictions.
event.motive: This was the IRA's response to new traffic restrictions.
event.weapdetail: 8 pound Semtex bomb with a timing device and detonator
event.scite1: Peter Burden, “Bomber at Bus Stop: Dramatic Moment when Armed Police Swooped on IRA Suspect,” Daily Mail (London), July 15, 1993.
event.scite2: “Police Question Bomb Suspect,” Agence France Presse, July 14, 1993.
event.scite3: Edward Pilkington, “Bomb-in-Bag Suspect Held in Street,” The Guardian (London), July 15, 1993.
